Legal_Issue: Whether the Commission breached procedural fairness by refusing legal counsel during employee interviews
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant (RBC) to demonstrate breach of procedural fairness
Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness does not require automatic presence of legal counsel during interviews; exceptions are limited
Procedural_Issue: Refusal to allow legal counsel during Commission interviews
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Commission's policy prioritizes witness comfort and free speech; no breach established
Key_Evidence_Considered: Commission's policy on third-party presence, RBC's refusal to make employees available
Applicant_Challenge: RBC challenged the Commission's refusal to allow counsel in interviews
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law principles of procedural fairness
Defendant_Response: Commission upheld its policy limiting third-party presence to ensure open testimony
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Commission's procedural decision
Outcome: Complaint referred to Tribunal for further inquiry; RBC's application dismissed
Remedy_Sought: To compel inclusion of legal counsel during interviews
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by referral to Tribunal
